title: Black Cleaver and LW items should be unique
body:
If you aren't going to make Black Cleaver melee only, at least make it so they can't stack Cleaver with either Mortal Reminder/LDR

At least this way there's somewhat of an incentive to not get black cleaver on adcs

replies.body:
Well, one thing to think about is that the way %pen stacks, it's less effective if you get it from multiple sources (You're not getting 35% + 24% = 59% armor pen, you're getting 51% armor pen (The actual reduction will be less than this, since Last Whisper doesn't factor base armor)). This is still a _lot_, but it's better than what it could be.

I can't speak for {{item:3033}}, since it's really there for the grievous wounds and has always had its niche, but with those nerfs to {{item:3036}}, I don't see any reason to stack it with Cleaver (the health on {{item:3071}}/{{item:3380}} causes LDR's Damage to go down) anymore.


However, I'm currently not really seeing much of a point to nerf the interaction between Cleaver and Last Whisper regardless, because the only marksman I'm aware of that frequently builds both in the same build is  {{champion:21}}, and I'm pretty sure she's going to be getting nerfs of her own fairly soon.
More penetration sorces how less effective

With no slightly tanky alternatives left open to Marksmen, I am fully against this. Melee already has {{item:3053}}  the only other relevant stats on marksmen would be between {{item:3071}} and a very distant 2nd of {{item:3022}} .

That is if you aren't talking about the Phage movement passive, which would only be granted on a largely wasted, highly expensive item such as Tri-Force, or the largely inferior Frozen Mallet.

Its not ridiculous at all. if they need items with health build Defensive items like i was already saying but dont ask for damage items to bolster your defense

>it was good enough in seasons 1 2and 3

It really wasn't though. Under that system of itemization, we had two major problems. First, carries couldn't viably itemize into defensive options. The opportunity cost was simply too high, with the sole exception of periods where GA was broken enough that 3-5 members of a team would purchase it. Having defense was not a real option, no more than buying an IE is for a tank trying to increase their damage nowadays.  Doing it was a very, very good way to lose. It was always better to take the risk on your enemies making a mistake and you getting to be useful, rather than building a pure defensive item and guaranteeing you wouldn't be useful. Having items with damage and small amounts of defense (PD rework, Death's Dance) allowed for defensive itemization to actually be an option for carries, instead of just a trap.

Second, ADC itemization at the time was incredibly cookie-cutter. You had no choices except highest-dps, so that's what you did. It was the exact same items, in the exact same order, on almost every character. Adding items with alternative strengths allowed for giving up some dps to actually be a realistic option.

>when adcs dropped building defensive items mages followed suit

Mages never bought defensive items. Mages who bought defensive items were either trolling or terrible, often both (again, excepting the "GA is OP" period). AD carries tried to in season 1 and eventually learned that it was a trap, but mage never were never stupid enough to believe that building a real tank item was anything but a trap. They built Zhonya's and relied on it if they needed safety.

MY POINT IS, there are fighters why need the dmg from those items, so the SPECIFIC idea of not being able to build both might not be the best solution.
